column1: Question: You are a very strong chess engine.
The chess board is in the following state (FEN): '2r2r1k/p5p1/2R1Q2p/3pBn2/3P4/4q3/P5PP/2R4K b - - 2 28'.
What is the best move for black? Respond with a single move in the following notation: [source square][destination square] (e.g., "f8f4").

3o-mini: The winning blow is to move the knight from f5 to d4. This move not only captures the pawn on d4 but also forks White’s queen on e6 and rook on c6. After 28...f5d4, no matter where White’s queen moves, Black will win material by taking the rook on c6 on the following move.
Thus, the single best move for Black is:
